sen.e: Toshimoto HINO (date of birth unknown, died June 3, 1332 (old lunar calendar) (June 26, 1332)) was a court noble in the end of Kamakura Period.

sen.j: 文保2年（1318年）に即位した後醍醐天皇の親政に参加し、蔵人となる。
sen.e: He joined shinsei (monarchy) of Emperor Godaigo, who enthroned in 1318, and became a kurodo (chamberlain).

sen.j: 後醍醐の朱子学（宋学）志向に影響を受け、鎌倉幕府討幕のための謀議に加わる。
sen.e: He was influenced by Emperor Godaigo's Neo-confucianism (Shugaku), and participated in the conspiracy to attack the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 諸国を巡り反幕府勢力を募るが六波羅探題に察知された。
sen.e: He traveled across Japan to recruit anti-shogunate forces; however, Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) scented his move.

sen.e: He was arrested again in the Genko Rebellion, which was the second anti-shogunate plot that was uncovered in 1331, and was sentenced to death in Kuzuharagaoka, Kamakura.

sen.j: 辞世の句は「秋を待たで葛原岡に消える身の露のうらみや世に残るらん」
sen.e: His death haiku (Japanese poem) was 'I will die before autumn in Kuzuharagaoka. My bitterness will remain forever'.

sen.j: 1887年（明治20年）には俊基を主祭神とする葛原岡神社が神奈川県鎌倉市梶原に創建され、俊基自身にも従三位が追贈された。
sen.e: Kuzuharagaoka-jinja Shrine was founded in Kajiwara, Kamakura City, Kanagawa Prefecture in 1887; shusaijin (main enshrined deity) of the shrine was Toshimoto; Toshimoto was also raised to Jusani (Senior Third Rank).
